newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Jan 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Jan 9.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on January 9:
WASHINGTON - The Supreme Court expressed grave concerns over the implications of declaring that dying patients have a right to a doctor's help in committing suicide.
WASHINGTON - Women who have an abortion during the first 18 weeks of pregnancy do not have an increased risk of getting breast cancer later in life, according to a new study.

JERUSALEM - Israeli-Palestinian negotiations on implementing Israel's promised withdrawal from Hebron suddenly foundered after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu proposed a two-year delay in the larger redeployment of troups from rural areas of the occupied West Bank.
WASHINGTON - The diverse group of physical complaints known as "Gulf War Syndrome" may be six distinct patterns of symptoms, a group of researchers said.
WASHINGTON - A District of Columbia resident whose Ford sport utility vehicle was stolen two days after Christmas got a tip that led him to his car after he offered a $5,000 reward.
